greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least positive m such that n!+m is prime.
comment: Conjecture: No term is a composite number. a(n) is a prime > 3*prime(k), where k is such that prime(k) < n <= prime(k+1). - _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 07 2004
Terms after n = 2000 correspond to Fermat and Lucas PRP. - _Phillip Poplin_, Oct 12 2019
link: Phillip Poplin, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..4000 (first 501 terms from T. D. Noe, then up to n=2000 from Hans Havermann)
Index entries for sequences related to factorial numbers
mathematica: a[n_] := (an = 1; While[ !PrimeQ[n! + an], an++]; an); Table[a[n], {n, 0, 63}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 05 2012 *)
results.author: _Jeff Burch_
ext: Better description from _Rick L. Shepherd_, Nov 06 2002
